page.title: 14LEE MOOR VILLAGE-NO SCHOOLS.
page.content: Twenty years ago there were more children in Lee Moor than there are today.Gradually numbers have dropped, until there are now very few children. There was a primary school until two years ago,when it was closed.Now the younger children in the area tend to go to Cornwood Primary school,although one goes to Shaugh Prior Primary School.This means that all the children of primary school age have to travel.The children of secondary school age travel over 5m to Ivybridge Comprehensive school.Some people say that when a village school closes the people living there move too,which seems to be the case.It is true that there is a higher than average retired percentage than normal.Few families seem to be attracted to the area now ,possibly due in part to the lack of local schools.
